text: (bright music)
- Hi, everyone. My name is Andrea Ketzer.

I'm in charge of the Tech
Strategy for Automotive
at Amazon Web Services.
I'm here in Las Vegas to meet Zoox
and to see their new taxi.
Mike White is here to show us around.

- So Zoox is an autonomous
ride hailing service.

We're pretty unique in so
far as we have manufactured

and built our own purpose-built
vehicle from the ground up.
It's really truly focused on the rider
and the rider experience.
- [Andrea] No driver?
- No driver at all. We are driven by AI.
- Can you give us a tour of the vehicle
and show us which sensors you're using?
- We have LiDAR, thermal, radar, camera.

- Can you tell us what
do you do with the data?
- That's where we leverage AWS.
So with S3 and EC2,

there's a lot of things we're
doing to train our models

using millions of miles
driven in complex situations
such that we can build our safety cases.
But with all this technology,

the key point is creating
incredible rider experience.

Let's go inside and see
what that might look like
within the cab.
- Oh yes. Let's see.
(bright music)

- This is really what the
whole Zoox experience is about.

And it's really the
configuration of the inside

of the vehicle that's completely
gonna transform mobility.

We've changed the way that
riders are going to move around.
And we've made it really about them
being in the center of it.
Being able to configure the cabin.
And because we have the carriage seating,

communicating is just so
much more natural and better.
You don't have to worry about driving.
The AI does that for you.

But I'm really curious
about what you're seeing
in the industry.
- Yeah, actually we see a revolution.
The new technologies like AI,

ML and GenAI are really
accelerating the way

how auto makers are
testing their software.

They don't need to collect
dangerous scenarios anymore
in the real world.

They use the technology,
they use AI, ML and GenAI
to generate synthetic digital scenarios.
- That's fantastic.
- So what's next for Zoox?
- [Michael] In 2025,

we're gonna take first
customers in Las Vegas,
with San Francisco to follow.

- Cool. Thank you.
- Thank you so much.
(bright music)
